Description.val:
This line item funds modifications to the E-8C Joint Surveillance Target Attack Radar System (JSTARS) aircraft through FY 2023. JSTARS was developed for ground surveillance, targeting, and battle management. The E-8C is a modified Boeing 707-300 airframe that provides a unique blend of Battle Management Command and Control (BMC2) and Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR). Air Battle Managers onboard the JSTARS use its wide area ground surveillance radar to build situational awareness and identify targets which are passed to strike assets or crossed cued with ISR platforms. The capability to perform this dual mission at the tactical edge both reduces the time to execute the kill chain and improves ISR collections across the range of military options.

There are 16 E-8Cs in the inventory plus 1 E-8A trainer. 

Funding may be used to address other general modernization and/or sustainment related procurement requirements such as but not limited to: Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS)/technical refreshes of hardware or software, aviation and security mandates, or safety of flight issues.  Funding may also be used to procure items associated with J/UONs or rapid acquisition/fielding requirements in support of combat requirements. 

Funding supports increased aircraft availability and deployability requirements to support the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act. 

A technical adjustment was requested in FY18 to move FY19 3600 funds to the 3010 Aircraft Procurement Appropriation line.  This move is necessary to fund the Common Data Link modification effort.

FY2018 ACCOMPLISHMENTS
- Completed procurement of PME/DM Kits #15 and 16
- Awarded contract for ELT
- Awarded contract for CENTRIXs
- Provided for Program Office Other Direct Costs 

FY19 funds cover three efforts:
- Common Data Link (CDL)(In CY FY19 CDL Mod is a new start)
- Funds JSTARS OCO rqmts such as, but not limited to, 360 FOV Camera, SW/OS, and SATCOM in support of war time needs.(FY19 funding totals include $13.0M in Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO))(A new start in FY19)
- Provide for Program Office Other Direct Costs

FY20 funds cover three efforts: 
- Distributed Mission Operations Center (DMOC)
- Continued procurement of CDL
- Provide for Program Office Other Direct Costs

As directed in the FY 2018 NDAA, Sec 825, amendment to PL 114-92 FY 2016 NDAA, Sec 828 Penalty for Cost Overruns, the FY 2018 Air Force penalty total is $14.373M. The calculated percentage reduction to each research, development, test and evaluation and procurement account will be allocated proportionally from all programs, projects, or activities under such account.

Justification.val: Where applicable, justification for individual modifications is provided in the P-3A exhibits.

Name.val: Prime Mission Equipment - Diminishing Manufacturing Sources
COMBINED ENTERPRISE REGIONAL INFORMATION EXHANGE SYSTEM (CENTRIXs)

Description.val:
A Technical Adjustment was submitted in FY18 to move FY19 3600 RDT&E funds in the amount of $14.888 to the PE 0207581F 3010 Procurement line.

Common Data Link (CDL)is a jam-resistant air-to-ground line-of-sight link from the JSTARS to the Army's Tactical Intelligence Ground Station (TGS) and USMC Tactical Exploitation Group Remote Work Station (TEG-RWS).  Current SCDL is encrypted using the KGV-8, which is near end of life and has been operating with an extended National Security Agency (NSA) wavier.  Section 144 of the FY18 NDAA has mandated that military aircraft use a specified standard data link, eliminating the waiver authority of the Deputy SECDEF on 1 October 23.  NSA, has also mandated type 1 encryption on all airborne Common Data Link (CDL) platforms.

Milestone/Development Status

No development is needed.

This program, P-3A Mod 38203, Distributed Mission Ops Center (DMOC), is a new start.
Description:
DMOC is a Distributed Mission Operations Center that provides JSTARS E-8C simulators for training.
Current DMOC block 30 JSTARS simulator is no longer concurrent with fielded systems / simulators.  The DMOC JSTARS simulator does not include ELMM/ARM and FBCB2 capabilities or other major Block 40 modifications such as new graphic displays, form-fit-function keyboards, updated operator workstation processors (alpa to HP 380 Gen8), and new imagery server.  Additionally, the current DMOC JSTARS simulator hardware configuration is not compatible with the IR 40.08 software update.

Milestone/Development Status

No development required

Milestone/Development Status

No development is required.
